sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination method:

2x + 3y - z = 10

4x + 2y + z = 1

x - y + 2z = -2

What are the values of x, y and z?
message_2:
First, we will write the augmented matrix for the given system of linear equations:

| 2  3 -1 | 10 |
| 4  2  1 |  1 |
| 1 -1  2 | -2 |

Step 1: Swap Row 1 and Row 3 to have a 1 in the top-left corner:

| 1 -1  2 | -2 |
| 4  2  1 |  1 |
| 2  3 -1 | 10 |

Step 2: Eliminate the 4 and 2 in the first column below the 1:

Row 2 = Row 2 - 4 * Row 1
Row 3 = Row 3 - 2 * Row 1

|  1 -1  2 | -2  |
|  0  6 -7 |  9  |
|  0  5 -5 | 14  |

Step 3: Divide Row 2 by 6 to get a 1 in the second row and second column:

Row 2 = Row 2 / 6

|  1 -1  2 | -2  |
|  0  1 -7/6 | 3/2 |
|  0  5 -5 | 14  |

Step 4: Eliminate the 5 in the second column below the 1:

Row 3 = Row 3 - 5 * Row 2

|  1 -1  2  | -2    |
|  0  1 -7/6 | 3/2  |
|  0  0  5/6 | 13/2 |

Step 5: Divide Row 3 by 5/6 to get a 1 in the third row and third column:

Row 3 = Row 3 / (5/6)

|  1 -1  2  | -2  |
|  0  1 -7/6 | 3/2 |
|  0  0  1   | 13/5 |

Step 6: Use back-substitution to find the values of x, y, and z:

z = 13/5

y = 3/2 + (7/6)(13/5) = 3/2 + 91/30 = 45/30 + 91/30 = 136/30

x = -2 - 2(13/5) + 136/30 = -60/30 + 52/30 = -8/30

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = -8/30 (or -4/15)
y = 136/30 (or 68/15)
z = 13/5
